meanings.definition: The quality or state of being stagy.
meanings.sent1: The staginesses of the play made it hard to take seriously.
meanings.sent2: Her acting had a certain staginesses that added charm to the performance.
meanings.sent3: The staginesses of the magician's tricks made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The staginesses of the old theater transported me back in time.
meanings.sent5: The staginesses of the costume design brought the characters to life.

meanings.definition: The exaggerated or artificial quality of a performance or production.
meanings.sent1: The director wanted to tone down the staginesses of the actors' delivery.
meanings.sent2: The singer's performance was criticized for its staginesses.
meanings.sent3: The staginesses of the clown's act made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The staginesses of the special effects created a surreal atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The staginesses of the set design overwhelmed the audience with its grandeur.
